name: Rectosigmoid Junction Ischemic Stricture
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain and inability to pass stool for 4 days
physical_findings: Tenderness in left lower quadrant without rebound
Hyperactive bowel sounds early, progressing to hypoactive
treatment: Emergency flexible sigmoidoscopy with possible stent placement
Possible segmental resection if necrosis present
prognosis: Guarded - depends on timing of intervention and extent of ischemia
description: A rare complication of chronic mesenteric ischemia where focal scarring at the rectosigmoid junction causes complete luminal obstruction. Often preceded by episodes of transient ischemic colitis. The watershed area at this junction is particularly vulnerable to low-flow states.
